Key Match Events: Mets pitcher Sean Manaea allowed only one run over seven innings, leading the Mets to a 7-2 victory in Game 3 of the NLDS.
Pete Alonso and Jesse Winker hit solo home runs in the second and fourth innings respectively to contribute to the Mets' win.
Post-Match Reflections: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza praised Sean Manaea's performance and demeanor on the mound after the game.
Mets players expressed relief and joy at being one win away from the NLCS.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets' victory kept their playoff run alive, with the team aiming to clinch the NLCS with a win in Game 4.
The game was a significant moment for the Mets, as they looked to secure their spot in the NLCS.
Others: The article provided a detailed account of the game's key moments and the Mets' path to victory.
